name: Holiday Inn Express Oakland

reviews.text: I had to get to the Airport for a flight back to Long Beach and the hotel bus was in the shop getting a new battery, so the Manager, Mr. James, took me to the airport in his red pick-up truck. .
reviews.title: Service

reviews.text: I satyed at this hotel last night. Everyhting was fine, but there were two minor problems. First, the bathroom was clean and smelled fresh, but when I lifted the toilet lid, I found that the toilet had not been cleaned since it was last used. Secondly, I appreciate when a coffeemaker is provided as it was in this room, but only decaffeinated coffe was available. I thought it would be nice to have a little caffeine at 4:30 a.m. Other than that, the room was large and comfortable as was the bed. The free computer and printer were great. The shuttle was prompt and all personnel were very friendly. I would stay again anytime I need to be near the Oakland airport.
reviews.title: A couple of minor problems

reviews.text: We arrived late on a Friday evening and figured it would be easier, and cheaper, to stay at a hotel close to the airport rather than paying alot for a room in San Francisco. We got the room for $93/nt and were pleased to find that the hotel was about a mile away from the Oakland Airport car rental center. Check-in and check-out was quick and friendly, and the rooms were very clean and quite nice! The beds were very comfortable and it was nice to wake up and go to the complimentary breakfast they offered in the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice room, close to airport

reviews.text: We stayed here during the last night of our vacation due to an early flight out of Oakland the following morning. The room was clean, had a king size bed that was a little lumpy and a nice mini fridge and sink. There is a very small work-out room and also a room with a whirlpool in it that actually has a lift for wheelchair bound individuals -- very handicapped accessible, which is quite rare. We used neither of those amenities, however. We did use the complimentary shuttle service several times. They will drop off and pick up anywhere within a 3 mile radius, including the airport, restaurants, airport car rental area, etc. We used it to go to and from the BART station (where we caught a train in to SF) and also at 4:30 a.m. to get to the airport. This is not a vacationer's hotel, but a business traveler's layover(as Holiday Inn Express is supposed to be). It was quiet, nice, convenient, but plain -- which was perfect for our situation. We would definitely stay here again if we found ourselves in the same situation.
reviews.title: Close to the airport! Great shuttle service!
Very convenient to Oakland Airport & quiet!
reviews.text: We stayed one night in the Holiday Inn Express Oakland Airport and we were very pleased with our room. We have stayed in many, many Holiday Inn Express hotels and this one is above average for that chain. First of all it is relatively new and the beds are comfortable. Secondly, for an airport location it is very quiet. We had a rental car to return so the location was ideal and the check-in. check-out was smooth. Although we didn't use the shuttle provided it was available for very early flights. The breakfast offered is the very standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast but for $132.00 per night (the rate we paid) we felt this hotel was a good value for the area, especially if you intend to feed your family before departing on a flight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was surprised to find that this hotel was rated at three stars. I was intrigued and looked forward to staying. I liked the hotel just fine. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. It is larger than better rated more expensive hotels. The bed is comfortable, nice large flat screen tv in the room, complimentary wireless internet access, refrigerator and microwave in the room. They have a fitness center, business center, airport shuttle, and offer complimentary continental breakfast, neither of which I tried. My main problem with this hotel was the lack of a restaurant, gift shop and room service which other hotels that have similar star ratings do have. My girlfriend and I stayed over Thanksgiving and just about everything, including gas station stores were either closed or did not have much to choose from. Although there are other hotels, bars, supermarkets nearby, it is not really an area to walk around in. Had I foreseen this, I would have spent the night elsewhere. If you have an early flight, the location is great since it is just a few minutes' drive, but if not flying out, perhaps something in downtown Oakland, Berkeley or Emeryville would be a better option. The front desk was a bit understaffed and when I called, the person was talking to someone else while trying to help me, then put me on hold for a long time and I finally had to come down to the desk personally. They offer in-room movies, but I find their system unusual and a little more complicated than most. I would rather just be able to order with the remote like other hotels. Amazingly, I did not hear any airplane noise that would keep me up. The parking lot is enclosed which makes me feel a little more secure.
reviews.title: Good basic hotel, but lacking amenities

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable room close to airport
likes.disliked: — lack of room service, restaurant, gift shop

reviews.text: The hotel is right beside the airport so it is a great place to stay before you fly. The hotel can pick you up at the rental car facilities or at the airport. The facilties were clean and the staff was pleasant.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.text: This hotel makes business travel easy. Close to the airport, free ample parking, easy access to significant freeways to quick access to many of my customers. Short distance to the Bart station. The hotel is consistantly clean, and good repair. I have stayed here on nearly a dozen trips to Oakland
reviews.title: My favorite Oakland Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Oakland Holiday Inn Express so that we could catch an early flight the next morning out of the Oakland Airport. The hotel is very close to the airport, but we did not hear any airplanes flying over, possibly because we were on the middle floor, away from the airport side of the building. Overall it is a very clean hotel, has a refrigerator and microwave in the room, and they also have a good included breakfast. The staff was friendly also.
reviews.title: Nice and Close to the Oakland Airport

reviews.title: 5 star comfort

reviews.text: Good location about one mile from Oakland Airport. Free Shuttle to and from airport as well as centralized car rental area for the airport. Room was clean and very functional. Only thing was the door to the bathroom had an automatic closer on it. I had to prop it open with a towel. The hotel is also undergoing a renovation and expansion, but it didn't affect my stay at all.
reviews.title: Go Location Close to Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night leaving our car for 7 nights - total tab was $209.79. The shuttle; we had to wait about 20 minutes for it to show up to the airport, and 10 minutes from the airport back after calling for a ride. The continental breakfast starts at 6:00am, so if you're leaving before 6:00 - you're too early and will miss out. The first set of keys/cards we got at check in didn't work in our room, had to go back for a second set. There is a dummy type door next to the check in where you (or they) can check your key/card to be sure it's activated. Excellent location if you're flying out of Oakland.
reviews.title: Very close to the Oakland airport.

reviews.text: We arrived at 4:30 am due to Amtrak being 12 hours late into Emeryville. HI Express was open and greeted us warmly, as if nothing was unusual about what we thought was a rather odd check in time. They gladly allowed us to stay longer than the usual check out time. Comfortable bed and rooms. Didn't actually spend that many hours there, but the hours we did spend were blissful. Thank you HI Express Oakland. Oh, and they also gave us a free shuttle to pick up our rental car.
reviews.title: perfect when you need them

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for an overnight after a late arrival from the east Coast. We could not have asked for more from a Holiday Inn Express. Comfortable beds, quiet, clean, new and quick check in.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

likes.liked: — Location from airport and comfortable rooms.

reviews.text: Based on Tripadvisor, you would think the #1 rating makes the Holiday Inn Express Oakland the best hotel in all of Oakland! Of course, that is simply not realistic given that HIE is hardly a full service hotel. It all depends on why you're there! It's undoubtedly just fine for a one night stay if you're coming from or going to the Oakland airport. I stayed at HIE for three nights as part of a small business meeting that was held there for reasons of saving company dollars.

reviews.title: An excellent end to our trip to California
reviews.text: We got there by rental car, and our flight was leaving at 6 a.m. So, we were there to relax. We stayed put there in the hotel room, and enjoyed the amenity of using our laptop and free internet service to check up on the airline schedules, email our families, etc. We then watched TV. The staff was courteous and very helpful. They gave us some pamphlets about the delievery establishments, so we ordered too much of a pizza. The rooms were clean and new, and our checkout was seamless. We will stay there again. It appears to be safe, and it is very close to the rental car returns, or you can turn your car in the night before, and get it over with, and they will send a shuttle to bring you back, and take you to the airport the next morning via shuttle. Four thumbs up, two from me, two from my lovely wife Jennifer!

reviews.title: Loved the EXPRESSNESS of Holiday Inn Express
reviews.text: I Have been going into Oakland for business three days out of the week, every week, for the last three years. Prices are high but all the hotels at the airport have high prices, unless you stay quite a distance from the airport, and I know people complain about LA traffic but Bay Area traffic is not that far behind. I love the holiday inn express!!!! They have no restaraunt which means no noise. Mostly all guests are just like me come in to sleep, wake up early and go to work.

reviews.title: OK
reviews.text: The most amazing thing about this hotel is that the people that work there treat you like you were family. Somehow they know everybody that walks through the door, and to someone that stays away from home as much as I do that puts a smile on your face. KUDOS to all of you guys, You are my home away from home!!!

description: The Holiday Inn Express & Suites is the closest hotel to the Oakland International Airport and centrally located between San Francisco and Silicon Valley.We welcome all guests either for work or play. Less than half a mile from the Oakland International Airport and just one mile from the Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum & Oracle Arena- home to the Oakland Raiders, the Oakland Athletics and the Golden State Warriors, you can really enjoy the home field advantage. All guest rooms are equipped with a microwave, wet bar, refrigerator & high-speed Internet access wired and wireless connections.We also serve a delicious hot buffet breakfast every morning, and we have a Manager's Reception served in our Lobby area on Tuesday, Wednesday, & Thursday from 5:30 PM until 7:30 PM.We are 100% non-smoking!
